This latest announcement, significantly upsizing their offering, is a testament to their continued conviction. Strategic Vision: MicroStrategy views Bitcoin as a superior store of value, a hedge against inflation, and a long-term investment that outperforms traditional assets. Market Opportunity: The current market dynamics, including growing institutional interest and the halving event, may present what MicroStrategy perceives as opportune moments for accumulation. This financial engineering allows MicroStrategy to leverage its balance sheet to acquire more Bitcoin , betting on the future appreciation of the digital asset to more than offset the cost of capital. Global Network Bitcoin operates on a decentralized, secure, and globally accessible network, making it a borderless asset for the digital age. headline: Ghana regulators move forward to cover $3 billion domestic crypto sector
summary: Ghana is preparing to introduce its first regulatory framework for cryptocurrency as usage of digital assets in the country surges to $3 billion . The Bank of Ghana (BoG) is expected to present a bill to parliament in September to oversee and regulate digital asset exchanges. BoG Governor Johnson Asiama said the main objective is to bring virtual currencies into the mainstream economy. He emphasized that the move would help the country collect reliable economic data, enhance transparency, attract investment, and generate revenue for the national budget. Asiama admitted they are now playing catch-up, noting that many Ghanaians already use cryptocurrencies to send and receive payments . However, most of these transactions remain invisible to regulators, making it difficult to measure the full scope of the country‚Äôs economic activity. According to Asiama, integrating crypto into the formal financial system is now critical, as millions of Ghanaians have already adopted it daily. The proposed bill will outline operational standards for digital asset platforms, detail consumer protection mechanisms, and establish tax obligations. It is also expected to strengthen financial oversight amid increasing concerns over money laundering and cross-border fraud. Ghana‚Äôs move reflects a broader trend across Africa, where governments are waking up to the reality that cryptocurrency is more than a passing trend. By licensing crypto platforms, Ghana hopes to tap into one of the fastest-growing sectors of its digital economy. Regulators target currency stability Ghana‚Äôs move to regulate cryptocurrency could also stabilize the Ghanaian cedi in the longer term, as the local currency has exhibited extreme volatility in recent years. The currency has appreciated by 48% in the last 12 months. But the increase came after it posted a steep drop of 25% in the preceding year, underscoring its volatility. This unpredictability makes monetary policy more challenging, particularly for Ghana, which heavily relies on imports. According to officials, regulating crypto would help the central bank better forecast and steer inflation. Governor Asiama explained that some of the capital flows in and out of the economy through cryptocurrencies were not captured in the country‚Äôs official data. He said this limited the central bank‚Äôs ability to make accurate economic decisions and impacted the cedi‚Äôs value. Now Ghana has a benchmark interest rate of 28%, and inflation fell to 13.7% in June. This wide differential indicates underlying economic dislocations that the BoG aims to alleviate with better data collection and financial inclusion. By regulating cryptocurrency, Ghana can better track money flows, monitor macroeconomic trends, and plan for long-term financial stability. It will also give the central bank greater visibility into how much crypto is being held, traded, or converted into foreign currency by individuals and businesses. Ghanaians and Nigerians lead surge in crypto use Web3 Africa Group‚Äôs chief executive officer, Del Titus Bawuah, said about 3 million Ghanaians ‚Äî or 17% of all adults in the country ‚Äî use virtual currencies. This includes Bitcoin, Ethereum, and stablecoins like USDT. Bawuah said the data showed that Ghanaians used cryptocurrencies for much more than just investment. He noted that people are paying for everyday services, sending money, and running businesses with crypto. He emphasized that it is no longer a niche trend but has become mainstream. According to Bawuah , traded crypto transactions in Ghana totaled $3 billion between July 2023 and June 2024. Nigeria recorded an even higher volume at $59 billion in crypto trades during the same period. Nigeria represents about half of sub-Saharan Africa‚Äôs $125 billion crypto volume. Observers say one reason for the boom is a lack of faith in the traditional banking system, and a difficulty getting hold of U.S. dollars. Crypto is a solution, at least for cross-border payments and e-commerce. Crypto could also help to improve regional trade by circumventing currency exchange barriers, said Craig Stoehr, general counsel at pan-African stablecoin payments platform Yellow Card. headline: Crypto Firms Raise Billions for Treasuries, But Aren‚Äôt Really Buying Crypto: Report
summary: A growing number of publicly traded companies are raising hundreds of millions of dollars to build crypto treasuries, but one analyst says many aren‚Äôt actually buying digital assets from the open market. Key Takeaways: Crypto treasury firms often receive insider crypto contributions instead of buying from the open market. These models allow early contributors to cash out at a premium once stocks surge. Analyst Ran Neuner warns the trend could mirror past bubbles, with retail investors left holding inflated shares. The crypto treasury trend took off after MicroStrategy‚Äôs headline-making Bitcoin purchases in 2020. Since then, companies like SharpLink Gaming, Upexi, and GameStop have announced multi-million or even billion-dollar fundraising efforts to build Ethereum, Solana, or Bitcoin treasuries. Yet, crypto prices remain relatively stable despite this supposed influx of demand. Crypto Treasuries Are Just Exit Vehicles for Insiders Talking to Forbes, crypto analyst Ran Neuner claimed that crypto treasury firms are acting less like buyers and more like exit vehicles for crypto insiders . Instead of purchasing assets directly from exchanges, these companies often receive crypto contributions from existing holders, in exchange for shares that later trade at massive premiums on public markets. For example, SharpLink‚Äôs $425 million Ethereum treasury wasn‚Äôt funded by institutions. According to Neuner, crypto holders contributed ETH in return for shares at net asset value. Once the company publicly declared itself an Ethereum treasury firm, the stock surged, giving early contributors a chance to cash out with significant upside. ‚ÄúAs soon as we announce to the market that this company is an ETH treasury company, the shares that you got at net asset value are going to be worth three times net asset value,‚Äù he said. https://twitter.com/gametheorizing/status/1946162921844756985 It‚Äôs a pattern that‚Äôs repeated across other firms. Upexi raised over $300 million while claiming to have acquired 1.9 million SOL . Bit Origin wants to raise $500 million for Dogecoin. GameStop allegedly converted $1.5 billion in debt into Bitcoin . Neuner said little of that activity appears to come from actual market buying. The underlying model benefits insiders as they get liquidity, regulatory legitimacy, and tax efficiency ‚Äî all while avoiding the price impact of selling on exchanges. Meanwhile, retail investors often end up paying 2-4x the net asset value for these stocks. Neuner warned that this is like a new form of leverage in crypto. Like past bubbles, he believes this treasury craze may burst just as suddenly. Doubts Grow Over Long-Term Viability of Bitcoin Treasury Strategy Skepticism around the sustainability of the Bitcoin treasury trend is growing. Last month, Glassnode lead analyst James Check raised concerns over the longevity of the corporate Bitcoin treasury strategy, arguing the easy gains might already be gone for new entrants as the market matures. The warning echoes recent comments from Matthew Sigel, head of digital asset research at VanEck, who has voiced concerns over the Bitcoin treasury strategies adopted by some publicly traded firms. Sigel singled out the use of at-the-market (ATM) share issuance programs, arguing that these can become dilutive if a company‚Äôs stock price nears its Bitcoin net asset value (NAV). headline: Bitzero raises $25M to expand clean crypto mining and data centres

headline: Crypto Hype Cools‚ÄîAnalyst Predicts When The Next Altcoin Surge Will Start
summary: Crypto markets awoke on Wednesday to the first meaningful bout of selling in more than a month, and Kev Capital TA did not sound surprised. In a late-night livestream, the analyst told viewers that Bitcoin‚Äôs failure to clear the ‚Äúbrick-wall‚Äù band between $120,000 and $123,000 had made an altcoin shake-out ‚Äúthe most obvious pullback spot ever,‚Äù capping four straight weeks of euphoric gains across Ethereum, Solana, Dogecoin, XRP and the rest of the sector. Crypto Bulls Crushed: Why Altcoins Ran Out Of Gas ‚ÄúDaily RSIs were at ninety on everything, including ETH, while Bitcoin was pinned under one-twenty,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat is a textbook sell wall. You don‚Äôt blast through that after running straight up for a month.‚Äù His chart of Total-2‚Äîthe market-cap index that strips out Bitcoin‚Äîshowed the gauge banging into the exact horizontal ceiling that had turned back altcoins in May, August and November 2021, again in December 2024, and once more in January this year. Each rebuff, he reminded the audience, had sparked corrections of 30-to-60 percent in the majors and far larger drawdowns in the speculative tail. Kev‚Äôs core message was that nothing in the current tape resembles a lasting top for the cycle. The move, he argued, is a pressure-release that clears excess leverage and restores ‚Äúrisk-free long exposure‚Äù for disciplined traders who skimmed profits on the way up. The fulcrum remains Bitcoin. Until the largest asset can establish weekly closes above the 1.0886 Fibonacci extension at $119,964, altcoins will ‚Äúrun out of gas.‚Äù He located initial Bitcoin support at $116,400, with deeper cushions at the $112‚Äì113k band and, in a worst-case flush, the $106.8k shelf. A break below the first of those levels ‚Äúisn‚Äôt necessary‚Äù in his view, but he warned new entrants against treating a ten-percent dip in their favorite microcap as a buying opportunity: ‚ÄúIf Total-2 drops another thirty percent, your altcoin is going down a lot more than ten.‚Äù Why, then, does he remain upbeat? Kev cited a confluence of on-chain and macro tailwinds that, in his back-testing, have never failed to resolve higher. Bitcoin‚Äôs weekly Hash Ribbons flashed a buy signal nine weeks ago and has advanced only eight percent since‚Äîfar below the historical mean of thirty-eight to one-hundred-one percent that materialises two to nine weeks after the trigger. A second, still-pending buy signal is ‚Äúcoming within the next week or two,‚Äù stacking probabilistic odds in favour of a leg higher. Related Reading: Crypto Market‚Äôs Fate Hangs On The Last Days Of July At the same time, he noted, the Federal Reserve‚Äôs quantitative-tightening program is ‚Äúbarely selling anything on the balance sheet,‚Äù while Truth Inflation‚Äôs real-time gauge pins headline CPI at 2.0‚Äì2.1 percent. A spate of tariff de-escalations‚Äîincluding a tentative, across-the-board fifteen-percent cut in EU-US duties announced moments before he went live‚Äîsuggests that inflation risks are skewing lower rather than higher. ‚ÄúAs long as the macro stays quiet‚Äîlow inflation, steady labour market, dovish policy projections‚Äîvaluations can march north,‚Äù he argued, adding that upcoming earnings from Google, Tesla and the rest of Big Tech will feed directly into crypto multiples because ‚Äúthe guidance is correlated whether you like it or not.‚Äù Seasonality is the wild card. August and September are notoriously fickle for risk assets, a period he likened to ‚Äúthe biggest vacation month of the year and then back-to-school.‚Äù Yet he stressed that cyclicality alone cannot trump a supportive macro backdrop. Instead, he expects a period of choppy consolidation‚Äîanchored by Bitcoin‚Äôs tussle with $120k and the golden-pocket bounce in Bitcoin Dominance‚Äîbefore the market‚Äôs next sustained advance. ‚ÄúWe are like the running back; the offensive line has opened the hole, but we haven‚Äôt burst through it yet,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf macro stays resilient, this is the year it finally happens.‚Äù His forward timeline therefore hinges on two visible catalysts: A decisive Bitcoin breakout above $123,000. When that prints on a multi-day close, he believes the four-year Total-2 ceiling will snap, unleashing capital rotation back into ETH and the broader alt market. ‚ÄúEverything leads back to Bitcoin,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúCrack that wall and the catch-up trade reignites.‚Äù Related Reading: House Passes Major Bills During ‚ÄòCrypto Week,‚Äô But Significant Changes May Take Time Second is the continuation of the benign macro mix through Q3. Should inflation hold near two percent and the Fed confirm an end-to-QT schedule in its September meeting, Kev projects the next Hash-Ribbons signal will ‚Äúplay out as violently bullish as the model has ever shown,‚Äù delivering what he calls the ‚Äúlast six-month window‚Äù of the cycle. Asked in chat ‚Äúwhen this pullback will be over,‚Äù the analyst refused to pin a date on it. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not looking at the clock,‚Äù he replied. ‚ÄúTime doesn‚Äôt matter; the levels do.‚Äù Still, his body language betrayed optimism: he plans no further sales, sees no need to add until volatility subsides, and‚Äîdespite acknowledging August‚Äôs chop potential‚Äîspoke repeatedly about ‚Äúriding what I have‚Äù into the final quarter of 2025. In other words, the cool-down now underway is less a bear-market omen than the mandatory breather before a potential breakout. Traders who missed the July run are advised to watch Bitcoin‚Äôs $116k and $112k buffers for signs of an exhaustion wick, monitor Bitcoin Dominance for a failure rally below sixty percent, and keep an eye on the next CPI print. If those dominoes fall in line, Kev Capital is confident the real fireworks‚Äîan altcoin surge that carries Total-2 into price discovery for the first time since 2021‚Äîwill begin ‚Äúsooner than most people think, and definitely while everyone‚Äôs still on summer holiday.‚Äù At press time, TOTAL2 stood at $1.44 trillion.
